page.title: 01WOKINGHAM - A MARKET TOWN
page.content: Wokingham is a small market town 25 miles west of London.Many of the buildings in the town centre reflect its historic past.Today Wokingham is a prosperous settlement in the computer and commuter belt of Berkshire.The growth of Wokingham has resulted in new housing and major roads being built on arable land around the town. The town centre provides goods and services.There are 3 supermarkets and many smaller shops.All major banks and building societies are in the town. Many activities are found in the town, these include Scouts, Guides, Youth Clubs, a small Theatre and Churches. Some workers commute to London, but low unemployment is due to the growth of the local electronics industry.The growth of this industry should ensure a continuing affluent lifestyle in a pleasant environment for most people.
